resources.string: Unlimited number of functions in PRO version!
Use disabled features in PRO version!
Sorry, but this is a PRO feature!

Function Inspector LITE 3.2

This application was developed by Georg Wiese.
 Please give some feedback and report any bugs! You can find contact information in the settings.

 Update 3.2:
 - Integrated definite Integral
 - Tangent equation
 - Improved table
 - Factor out (settings)
 - bug fixes

 Update 3.1:
 - new functions
 - redesigned keyboard
 - Splash Screen
 - Italian translation
 - bug fixes

 Update 3.0:
 - unlimited number of equations
 - redesigned keyboard
 - three parameters
 - display discontinuities
 - redesigned menu layout
 - better performance
 - much more...

 Update 2.8:
 - detects asymptotes

 Update 2.7:
 - improved look
 - screenshots now in extra folder
 - improved Buy-Dialog
 - bug fixes

 Update 2.6:
 - spanish translation
 - survey (in settings)
 - free PRO trial (LITE)
 - up to three functions in LITE version
 - scale x and y independently (PRO)

 Update 2.5:
 - link to IntegralCalc
 - save Functions
 - Trackball support in Tracing/Slope mode
 - minor improvements

 Update 2.0:
 - Inflection points
 - Tracing/Slope mode including tables

 Update 1.1.1:
 - Chinese language
 - Bug fixes

 Update 1.1:
 - Settings
 - light color schema
 - Bug fix

 Update 1.0.1:
 - Bug fix

 Update 1.0:
 - "Special points" Button
 - animated windows

 Update 0.9.3:
 - Many bug fixes

 Update 0.9.2:
 - improved zoom
 - several bugfixes
 - fewer Upgrade messages (LITE)
 - ability to share screenshots

 Update 0.9.1:
 - improved icon
 - smoother scrolling

Please consider to buy the PRO version of Function Inspector!
 This is what you get:
 - unlimited number of equations
 - no ads, full screen
 - display extrema, discontinuities, intersections of graphs and inflection points
 - get the slope of the graph in any point
 - second color scheme
 - three parameters
 - screen shot without water mark

 You can use a free trial by clicking the button below.
If you like Function Inspector, I suggest visiting the new Function Inspector Facebook page ;)
Function Inspector PRO is being sold on various platforms which might have different prices.\n\n
You can test Function Inspector PRO once until you restart it.\n In order to start the trial period, click the button below.

Thank you for your decision to download Function Inspector!
 As the developer of this application I ask you to rate it the Android market and leave a comment if you like to!

 If you are not satisfied with Function Inspector, please let me know your criticism using the contact information you find in the settings!

 Also, you would help me a lot if you would take a few seconds to take the survey that is linked to in the settings ;)

 Georg Wiese
Check if you want to start Function Inspector PRO in fullscreen mode
Check if you want to keep the same ratio between X and Y scale
This is where your screenshots are saved
Here, you can factor out certain constants from the labels.
Please take a few seconds to fill out a survey
Please email any suggestions, bug reports, desired features and feedback
Visit the Function Inspector Facebook page to stay tuned!
I hope you enjoy Function Inspector PRO!
Make use of plenty new features in Function Inspector PRO!
Those are the tangent equations at x=
This feature is only enabled in Function Inspector PRO!

When Function Inspector is in Tracing or Slope mode, touching the screen sets the x-value of a point of each graph.\n Panning can be achieved by using two fingers and zooming still works with double click and the zoom buttons.
The End value has to be bigger than the Start value!
Only the first three functions will be displayed!

IntegralCalc is an application that is also made by Georg Wiese and allows you to calculate the definite integral of any function.\n Starting with Function Inspector 2.5 and IntegralCalc 2.0 both applications are linked.\n
This feature only works in the PRO version!

Those are the functions that you can use in your equations:

 - sqrt(): Square Root
 - abs(): Absolute Value
 - ln(): Natural Logarithm
 - log(): Base 10 logarithm
 - sin(): Sine
 - cos(): Cosine
 - tan(): Tangent
 - asin(): Inverse Sine
 - acos(): Inverse Cosine
 - atan(): Inverse Tangent
 - sinh(): Hyperbolic Sine
 - cosh(): Hyperbolic Cosine
 - tanh(): Hyperbolic Tangent
 - asinh(): Inverse Hyperbolic Sine
 - acosh(): Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine
 - atanh(): Inverse Hyperbolic Tangent
